description: Every now and then we've been seeing an error from libvirt "libvirtError: internal error: Some processes refused to die" when destroying containers. This appears to happen when libvirt attempts to kill all of the processes in a container, but they don't die fast enough. The containers seem to eventually die, but by that point Nova has already errored the destroy. If we catch this error and let the wait_for_destroy logic take over, the destroy should finish just fine.
title: Some processes refused to die error on libvirt-lxc destroy

Author: Andrew Melton <email address hidden>
Date:   Wed Jan 21 21:19:52 2015 -0500

    Libvirt: Gracefully Handle Destroy Error For LXC
    
    When libvirt destroys a container it will attempt to send a shutdown
    to the init process, then kill all of the procceses left over. If
    they don't die fast enough, libvirt will raise an error. The
    container will eventually die in most cases. So, instead of erroring
    the destroy, we should let the wait_for_destroy logic continue to
    see if the instance goes away.
    
    Change-Id: I1feb767e82bc77ad7ae63852a043d67844245626
    Closes-Bug: #1413705
